required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of MK0736 & MK0916 in Patients With Hypertension (High Blood Pressure)(0736-003)(COMPLETED)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of MK0736 and MK0916 in Hypertensive Patients

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of two investigational drugs (MK-0736 and MK-0916) in lowering blood pressure and body weight in patients with hypertension (high blood pressure).
This is an early phase trial and some specific protocol information is proprietary and not publicly available at this time. (Full information is available to trial participants).

detailed_description.textblock: Participants enrolled in the study will be separated into 2 strata based on baseline body mass index (BMI) assessments prior to being randomly assigned to study treatment. Study will include a 24-week treatment period comprised of 2 phases, A and B, each of which will 12 weeks in duration.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Trough Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 12 in Participants With Higher Body Mass Indices (BMI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 12 (end of Phase A)
primary_outcome.description: Sitting diastolic blood pressure measured in triplicate at baseline and after 12 weeks of study drug administration. Mean value of the 3 measurements at the 2 timepoints was recorded.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Reported a Clinical Adverse Event
primary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function, or chemistry of the body temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, whether or not considered related to the use of the product. Any worsening (i.e., any clinically significant adverse change in frequency and/or intensity) of a preexisting condition which is temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, is also an AE. A clinical AE was an AE reported as a result of a clinical examination.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Reported a Laboratory Adverse Event
primary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function, or chemistry of the body temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, whether or not considered related to the use of the product. Any worsening (i.e., any clinically significant adverse change in frequency and/or intensity) of a preexisting condition which is temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, is also an AE. A laboratory AE was an AE reported as a result of a laboratory assessment or test.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Were Discontinued From Study Due to Clinical Adverse Event
primary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function, or chemistry of the body temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, whether or not considered related to the use of the product. Any worsening (i.e., any clinically significant adverse change in frequency and/or intensity) of a preexisting condition which is temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, is also an AE. A clinical AE was an AE reported as a result of a clinical examination.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Were Discontinued From Study Due to Laboratory Adverse Event
primary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function, or chemistry of the body temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, whether or not considered related to the use of the product. Any worsening (i.e., any clinically significant adverse change in frequency and/or intensity) of a preexisting condition which is temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, is also an AE. A laboratory AE was an AE reported as a result of a laboratory assessment or test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Trough Sitting Systolic Blood Pressure (SiSBP) at Week 12 in Participants With Higher Body Mass Indices (BMI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 12 (end of Phase A)
secondary_outcome.description: Sitting systolic blood pressure measured in triplicate at baseline and after 12 weeks of study drug administration. Mean trough value of the 3 measurements at the 2 timepoints was recorded.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Body Weight (kg) at Week 12 in Participants With Higher BMI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 12 (end of Phase A)
secondary_outcome.description: Weight was measured in duplicate (2 measurements) at baseline and after 12 weeks of study drug administration. The mean of the 2 values at each assessment was used in analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Waist Circumference at Week 12 in Participants With Higher BMI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 12 (end of Phase A)
secondary_outcome.description: Waist circumference measured in cm at baseline and after 12 weeks of study drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Low Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C) at Week 12 in Participants With Higher Body Mass Indices (BMI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 12 (end of Phase A)
secondary_outcome.description: LDL-C was calculated by the method of Friedewald equation at baseline and after 12 weeks of study drug administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline for High Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C) at Week 12 in Participants With Higher BMI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 12 (end of Phase A)
secondary_outcome.description: HDL-C measured at baseline and after 12 weeks of study drug administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Triglycerides (TG) at Week 12 in Participants With Higher Body Mass Indices (BMI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 12 (end of Phase A)
secondary_outcome.description: TG measured at baseline and after 12 weeks of study drug administration

arm_group.description: Participants administered MK-0736 2mg tablet once daily for 12 weeks (Phase A) then administered placebo once daily for 12 weeks (Phase B)
Participants administered MK-0736 7mg tablet once daily for 12 weeks (Phase A) then administered placebo once daily for 12 weeks (Phase B)
Participants administered MK-0916 6mg tablet once daily in both Phase A (12 weeks) and Phase B (12 weeks)
Participants administered placebo tablet once daily in both Phase A (12 weeks) and Phase B (12 weeks)
Participants administered MK-0916 6mg tablet once daily in both Phase A (12 weeks) and Phase B (12 weeks)
Participants administered placebo tablet once daily in both Phase A (12 weeks) and Phase B (12 weeks)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hypertension systolic blood pressure (SBP) </= 160mm Hg and diastolic blood pressure (DBP): 90-105mm Hg
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pre-menopausal women
- patients currently taking more than two (2) blood pressure lowering medications
- Body Mas Index (BMI)>40 kg/m2 (morbidly obese patients)
- History of Alcohol abuse (<3 Years)
- History of diabetes,chronic kidney disease, Active liver disease, recent heart attack or stroke

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Enrolled participants were divided into 2 strata: higher body mass index (BMI) (27 kg/m^2≤BMI<41 kg/m^2) and lower BMI (20 kg/m^2≤BMI<27 kg/m^2) prior to being randomly assigned study treatment. Data from High BMI groups were to be utilized in the primary and secondary analyses; data from low BMI groups were to be utilized in exploratory analyses.

group.title: High BMI:MK-0736 2mg→Placebo
group.description: Participants administered MK-0736 2mg tablet once daily for 12 weeks (Phase A) then administered placebo once daily for 12 weeks (Phase B)

group.description: Participants administered placebo tablet once daily in both Phase A (12 weeks) and Phase B (12 weeks)

group.description: Participants administered MK-0916 6mg tablet once daily in both Phase A (12 weeks) and Phase B (12 weeks)

group.description: Participants administered placebo tablet once daily in both Phase A (12 weeks) and Phase B (12 weeks)

group.description: Participants administered MK-0736 2mg tablet once daily for 12 weeks (Phase A) then administered placebo once daily for 12 weeks (Phase B)

group.description: Participants who received MK-0916 6 mg in Phase A and continued on MK-0916 6 mg for 12 weeks in Phase B

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Trough Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 12 in Participants With Higher Body Mass Indices (BMI)
outcome.description: Sitting diastolic blood pressure measured in triplicate at baseline and after 12 weeks of study drug administration. Mean value of the 3 measurements at the 2 timepoints was recorded.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 12 (end of Phase A)
outcome.population: Higher BMI participants in the All Patients Treated (APT) Population, which included all randomized participants who had valid efficacy measurements at baseline and at least once during the double-blind treatment period. The MK-0916 6.0 mg and Placebo Low BMI groups were not included in the planned analysis for this endpoint.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Reported a Clinical Adverse Event
outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function, or chemistry of the body temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, whether or not considered related to the use of the product. Any worsening (i.e., any clinically significant adverse change in frequency and/or intensity) of a preexisting condition which is temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, is also an AE. A clinical AE was an AE reported as a result of a clinical examination.
outcome.population: All Patients as Treated (ApaT) population, defined as all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study therapy.

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Were Discontinued From Study Due to Clinical Adverse Event
measure.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function, or chemistry of the body temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, whether or not considered related to the use of the product. Any worsening (i.e., any clinically significant adverse change in frequency and/or intensity) of a preexisting condition which is temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, is also an AE. A clinical AE was an AE reported as a result of a clinical examination.
measure.population: All Patients as Treated (ApaT) population, defined as all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study therapy.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Were Discontinued From Study Due to Laboratory Adverse Event
outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function, or chemistry of the body temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, whether or not considered related to the use of the product. Any worsening (i.e., any clinically significant adverse change in frequency and/or intensity) of a preexisting condition which is temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, is also an AE. A laboratory AE was an AE reported as a result of a laboratory assessment or test.
outcome.population: All Patients as Treated (ApaT) population, defined as all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study therapy.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The SPONSOR must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the SPONSOR as confidential must be deleted prior to submission. SPONSOR review can be expedited to meet publication guidelines.
